page.title: 12Local history. The Riviera
page.content: There used to be an open-air swimming pool in Norden called the Riviera.It opened in 1935 and shut down in 1966. It was really nice. There were two pools, diving stages and a water chute. At night dances were held there and the trees were covered in fairy lights. Miranda's granny worked in the cafe there. She told us that she worked at weekends as a waitress. The hours were 10:00 am. to 11:00 pm. A ghost was said to appear sometimes but its presence was felt mostly in the kitchen, seeming to brush your shoulders or arms. Sometimes it was seen by staff after closing time. On hot summer days hundreds of people went to the Riviera to swim and sunbathe. Now it has all gone, only trees and rubbish remain.
